checkAllowance(address,IERC20).details: - internal function that checks for token allowance

params.token: - contract address of the ERC20 token
params.txFrom: - the address of the transaction sender

externalCall(bytes,address).details: returns the value as-is, handle the return value decoding in the calling method

params._payload: - the the encoded function signature in bytes
params._to: - the contract address to send external call.

externalDelegateCall(bytes,address).details: returns the value as-is, handle the return value decoding in the calling method

params._payload: - the the encoded function signature in bytes
params._to: - the contract address to delegate call to.

externalStaticcall(bytes,address).details: returns the value as-is without comparison

params._payload: - the the encoded function signature in bytes
params._to: - the contract address to send external call.

handleTokenTransfer(address,address,uint.details: - internal function that handles transfer of ERC20 tokens

params.amount: - amount of tokens to be transferred to fee Receiver
params.from: - the address of the transaction sender
params.to: - (optional) the address of fee receiver or VA
params.token: - contract address of the ERC20 token

previewDelegation(bytes32[] storage,byte.details: checks that this paymaster can sponsor gas on behalf of another paymaster

total(bytes).details: 0 means we don't know the length of the signature. i.e you should always explicitly check for the length if this method returns 0

useDelegate(bytes32[],bytes32).details: this functions checks if the delegating paymaster is a sibling because only a sibling paymaster can delegate its userOp to another sibling

params.delegateNamehash: the subdomain namehash that is originally meant to pay the gas fee

externalCall(bytes,address).notice: function for making the actual external call

externalDelegateCall(bytes,address).notice: function for making the actual delegatecall

externalStaticcall(bytes,address).notice: function for making the actual external call

total(bytes).notice: gets the actual number of signatures passed with the userOp in paymasterInput

documentation.text:
@dev checks that this paymaster can sponsor gas on behalf of another paymaster
 @param destNamehash originally intended paymaster
